method.text: Melt the butter in a pan. Fry onion for 2-3 min until softened. Remove from heat. Add the garlic. Leave to stand.
Lay the chicken between two sheets of greaseproof paper. Flatten slightly with a rolling pin. Carefully cut through the centre of each - then open the pieces out flat.
Lay a slice of ham over each piece of chicken.
In a bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs, tarragon and garlic butter mixture. Season to taste. Mix in the egg white to bind. Spoon onto the ham slices.
Carefully roll up the chicken, incorporating the stuffing in the middle. Wrap two rashers of bacon around each chicken 'roll', to hold in place.
Arrange chicken on a lightly greased baking tray. Brush with a little oil. Cook in oven for 40 min or until chicken is cooked.
Remove from the oven. Cut into slices. Arranged on warmed serving plates.
